ch.pschatzmann.jflightcontroller4pi.devices

Class IMUDevice

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.pschatzmann.jflightcontroller4pi.devices.IMUDevice
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IFrequency, IDevice, IOutDevice

    public class IMUDevice
extends java.lang.Object
implements IOutDevice
    Integration device for the Inertial measurement unit (IMU) into our Flight Controller to determine the pitch, roll, yaw and heading. Estimates the speed; Estimates the position; Determines altidude above ground from the measured air pressure difference. The processing is running with it's own timer where the frequency is defined in the IMU.
    Author:
    pschatzmann

      Compass.Heading getHeading()
      The compass heading can then be determined by the direction value D: If D is greater than 337.25 degrees or less than 22.5 degrees – North If D is between 292.5 degrees and 337.25 degrees – North-West If D is between 247.5 degrees and 292.5 degrees – West If D is between 202.5 degrees and 247.5 degrees – South-West If D is between 157.5 degrees and 202.5 degrees – South If D is between 112.5 degrees and 157.5 degrees – South-East If D is between 67.5 degrees and 112.5 degrees – East If D is between 0 degrees and 67.5 degrees – North-East

        public Compass.Heading getHeading()

      • sealevel

        public static double sealevel(double pressure,
                              double altitude)
        Given a pressure P (mb) taken at a specific altitude (meters), return the equivalent pressure (mb) at sea level. This produces pressure readings that can be used for weather measurements.
